title: Riot, Why do you hate vision wards?
body: So, you get rid of sightstone, and then gate it behind Gold generation items, which you'll get at about 10 minutes, maybe sooner if you're doing well, and now you remove Tracker's Knife. Do you just despise vision wards so much that you want to remove any way of getting them out? what next? you remove trinkets from the game?

replies.body:

Games dragged on forever because you couldn't catch people out, you couldn't gank as effectively past early game, you couldn't set up to make plays because literal entire sections of the map were lit up like a christmas tree. 

Personally, I liked that, fucked getting ganked, but it made for less then entertaining games to watch so nixed the vision was.

Apparently riot wants to turn LoL into a hots clone now except hots is more fun than this abomination.

That's exactly where Shen and TP used to such a problem in the past but it's really sad how people easily forget the early problems League faced and just want to backtrack to them.

Maybe the question is how limited it should be. Before, anyone could (but didn’t) buy a sightstone. That was combined into support items. Now tracker knife is being removed. Unless you’re in higher elo (I assume), vision is pretty rare.

It's definitely a question of how limited it should be. Vision as a rarity is being taken as a negative by many in this case. I think that over the longer term especially, it will be a positive change.

If we give the game a massive supply vision to be constantly placing and removing during the game, you'd be wise to spend your time doing that, because vision is so powerful. In the absence of some of that vision, you'll fill that time doing the next most powerful thing, and that thing is probably more fun and engaging.

It's about finding the right amount of vision that keeps the game strategically enticing without it being the main thing you do to win the game.

>In the absence of some of that vision, you'll fill that time doing the next most powerful thing, and that thing is probably more fun and engaging.

It absolutely is until a jungler shows up and forces a flash/kills you because you can't keep vision up all the time.

Unfortunately this is the stark reality.

It’s all fun and games until the jungler shows up, then you’re in an unwinnable lane and theres sweet fuck all you can do outside of play safe; the very thing limited vision supposedly tries to discourage

So you have to think ahead while laning.  If you have trinkets, then you can push the wave to your opponent’s tower and place a ward to spot the jungler.  If not, then you have to keep the wave at or behind the middle of the lane.  Since moving the wave takes time, you’ll have to think about how many wards you have left before you push it.

If you want more vision than your trinkets offer, then you can buy control wards.  Since you have only so many, they become something to contest.  Find your opponent’s last control ward, and you can freeze the wave, knowing that they won’t have enough vision to cover every gank route.

I like this idea.

Except at least in the games I play and watch (Plat-Diamond) limited vision KILLS interactivity by laners because when vision is down you have to play extremely passive and safe due to the potency and effectiveness of jungler ganks.

This in turn kills trading by laners and instead enforces a farm-off or even worse forgoing farm and XP in the hope of staying alive.

The problem isn't vision though.  Limited vision is fine if I knew that even when the jungler shows up I have a good chance of making it out if I play my abilities right.  Unfortunately, with mobility, CC, jungler clear health and tower damage being what it is, this is usually not the case.

Getting unexpectedly jumped on from the fow because you have no vision will never be fun or engaging. Oh cool, rengar/khazix/twitch/etc... just deleted someone before they could respond. gg. That's not at all engaging.

It's not like people spammed wards when green wards were a thing, anyway  ;)
I mean, people complain about vision not being accessible enough, but when it was available to anyone it wasn't like they are depicting it...?

Have you considered shifting more vision to plants or other environmental features? The problem with ward-based vision is that it consistently doesn't feel fun to use, even if it's quite powerful, and at certain levels of play it can even be confusing when a player doesn't know they got caught because they stood on an invisible ward. In organized play, wards are also kept at maximum uptime, or close to it, whenever they're made available, so even when their usage is capped, they can still force stalemates in certain important areas, particularly when Zombie Ward factors in as well. By contrast, plants and Scuttle act more as temporary power-ups, and so could allow for a vision system that could be more engaging to players, and that could allow for vision options that wards don't provide, while also limiting the amount of vision any team can have over a certain area.

How would you feel about allowing players to be able to place up to 2 pink wards on the map at once?  It's always feels kinda bad when you put down a really deep pink ward that gives your team good vision, but then if you want to use another pink to clear out baron/dragon all of that vision goes away.

This is just part of the way Riot wants their game to go.  Vision can, to an extent, help a team that is behind.  Even if it is a minor mitigation, more vision could help to prevent snowballing... but Riot clearly likes faster games with more one-sides matches.  They may claim that they don't want their game to devolve into what it has become but their actions would suggest otherwise.

In theory, if Riot removes wards from cheaper early game purchases that basically everyone will have access to before severe snowball, that helps the team getting stomped. The more behind a team is, the fewer wards they can safely have out anyways since everything is dangerous and the winning team can clear them. Having less wards affects the team that's ahead more since they lose more potential vision.
They didn’t want supports to be vision bots like before yet they removed almost every adequate available vision from the game.

controlwards, free trinktes, zombieward, ghostporo, visionplant. yep, entirety of vision removed. Compare this to season 4 there wards needed to be purchaised and trinket needed to be upgraded for 475 gold (which no one realy did lowelo).

You mean the upgrade that cost less than that, to get 1 ward recharged a minute that would last 3 minutes, effectively letting you keep up 3 wards at a time, upgrading from the current version of the trinket that is all we have?  

that also had a ~200g upgrade into a redward trinket so you didn't need to waste an item slot to have pinks?  You mean those trinkets? LMFAO you don't know what you're talking about.

Having no limit on pinks, having them be invisible, having no limits on wards and the ability to have 50+ in your inventory if you so desired is worth so much more to the vision game than never being able to purchase wards, and having worse trinkets.  There simply isn't a comparison. 

If you brought back green wards at 75g, or hell, even 100g, but removed the ward cap, you'd see people in ***EVERY SINGLE LANE, EVERY SINGLE GAME*** purchase multiple wards per game at higher Elo and in competitive play.  Just because bronzies and silvers won't make good use of items/tactics/abilities/strategies/team comps/rotations, or literally anything else that better players know to do, and know they need to use to have an optimal shot at victory does not somehow make those items/strategies/etc worse, or in anyway lesser.

It just means those players are playing poorly and could be doing much better.
